titleStmt.title: An Account of the arraignment, tryal, and condemnation of Jonathan Frost, the clipper, upon June the 17th instant, at the Marshelsey in Southwark
titleStmt.author: Frost, Jonathan.
Griffin, William, 17th cent.

notesStmt.note: William Griffin, Frost's servant, was also accused of clipping money, but he was acquitted during the trial.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
